doc.field: One bound minute book of the fire wardens of the Town (and later City) of Williamsburgh in Kings County, spanning the period 1845 to 1857. The book contains minutes of meetings of the fire wardens, a register of wardens, rolls of attendance at meetings, accounts, and a record of attendance at fires.

One bound minute book of the fire wardens of the Town (and later City) of Williamsburgh in Kings County, spanning the period 1845 to 1857. The book contains minutes of meetings of the fire wardens, a register of wardens, rolls of attendance at meetings, accounts, and a record of attendance at fires.

One bound minute book of the fire wardens of the Town (and later City) of Williamsburgh in Kings County, spanning the period 1845 to 1857. The book contains minutes of meetings of the fire wardens, a register of wardens, rolls of attendance at meetings, accounts, and a record of attendance at fires.

The village of Williamsburgh in Kings County was incorporated as a town in 1840, and later as the City of Williamsburg (dropping the final "h" from its name) in 1851. The city's fire prevention services were carried out entirely by volunteer fire fighters until 1869, when the City of Brooklyn (with which Williamsburg merged in 1855) established its first paid professional Fire Department.
Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
